oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mayor Ben West with Japanese representatives at Genesco, 1961 March 09
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: Nashville Mayor Ben West shaking hands with Tokyo shoe manufacturing official Yasuma Oda (director of Chiyoda and of Genesco Japan) at the Genesco headquarters in Nashville on March 9th, 1961. Oda and three other businessmen from Tokyo were visiting the facility on a 10-day tour and inspection. The businessmen were also awarded gold keys and honorary citizenship of Nashville by Mayor Ben West. Genesco was originally founded as the Jarman Shoe Company in 1924 as a footwear manufacturer, they were later renamed the General Shoe Company in the 1930s. The company took its current name, Genesco, in 1959. Under the leadership of W. Maxey Jarman, the son of co-founder J.F. Jarman, the company began the process of diversifying and expanding the business into an international apparel conglomerate. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
